titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the restrictions on retirement savings deductions added by the Tax Reform Act of 1986, and to allow up to a $2,000 deduction for retirement savings for a nonworking spouse.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 4/28/1988--Introduced. Repeals the limitations enacted by the Tax Reform Act of 1986 on individual retirement account (IRA) deductions for active participants in certain pension plans. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to permit a nonworking or the lesser-earning spouse filing a joint income tax return to include the spouse's compensation in calculations made to determine the maximum amount permitted as a deduction for qualified retirement contributions (thus permitting such a taxpayer to deduct up to $2,000).
